Authors:
César Adrián González-Martínez, Lucio Lozada-Perez, Sandra
Rios-Carrasco, Leonardo O. Alvarado-Cardenas, César Ramiro
Martínez-González, Jose Manuel Castro-Lara, Jaime Jimenez-Ramirez
Title:
Ipomoea kahloiae (Convolvulaceae), a noteworthy new species
endemic to Guerrero, Mexico
Keywords:
Astripomoeinae; Frida Kahlo; IUCN; morning glory;
systematics.
Abstract:
A new species of Ipomoea, I. kahloiae, is described and
illustrated. It is endemic to tropical semideciduous forests in the
Acahuizotla area in the Sierra Madre del Sur of Guerrero, Mexico.
Information about its distribution, ecology, conservation and morphology
is provided. Phylograms are presented to clarify the relationships of
this new species within Ipomoea.
